docs.abstract: Tobacco companies have cash and urgency, but weed companies can probably find better strategic partners from which to receive investment.
docs.snippet: Tobacco companies have cash and urgency, but weed companies can probably find better strategic partners from which to receive investment.
docs.lead_paragraph: Get the DealBook newsletter to make sense of major business and policy headlines — and the power-brokers who shape them.__________

headline.main: The Weed Industry May Be Better Off Without the Support of Big Tobacco

docs.abstract: Terms were unknown, but Altria, the maker of Marlboro cigarettes, would probably have to pay a substantial amount for the e-cigarette company, which critics say has targeted teenage customers.
docs.snippet: Terms were unknown, but Altria, the maker of Marlboro cigarettes, would probably have to pay a substantial amount for the e-cigarette company, which critics say has targeted teenage customers.
docs.lead_paragraph: The Altria Group, whose fortune was built on traditional cigarette brands like Marlboro, is in talks to buy a minority stake in Juul Labs, the start-up that has captured much of the market for e-cigarettes, two people briefed on the matter said on Wednesday.

headline.main: Altria Is Said to Be Seeking a Stake in Juul
headline.print_headline: Altria Is Said to Be Seeking a Stake in Juul

byline.original: By Michael J. de la Merced and Sheila Kaplan

docs.abstract: It’s using the slick, high-tech disguise of vaping.
docs.snippet: It’s using the slick, high-tech disguise of vaping.
docs.lead_paragraph: Twenty years ago, as a creative director, I helped create a commercial for the Truth campaign to introduce its effort to prevent cigarette smoking by young people. The spot was simply footage of tobacco executives all testifying, “I believe nicotine is not addictive.” All we did was add a laugh track.

headline.main: How Big Tobacco Got a New Generation Hooked

docs.abstract: Plus, WeWork’s chief executive steps down.
docs.snippet: Plus, WeWork’s chief executive steps down.
docs.lead_paragraph: It’s tough to say who had a worse week — President Trump, WeWork or the vaping industry. (O.K., it’s pretty obvious — here’s a handy guide to the impeachment process, should you be curious.) Vegans, on the other hand, should be delighted. To find out why, read on.

headline.main: The Week in Business: The Economics of Impeachment

keywords.name: organizations

docs.abstract: The company planted the seeds of a public health crisis by marketing to millennials, who had low smoking rates, and it ignored evidence that teenagers were using its products.
docs.snippet: The company planted the seeds of a public health crisis by marketing to millennials, who had low smoking rates, and it ignored evidence that teenagers were using its products.
docs.lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO — In the face of mounting investigations, subpoenas and lawsuits, Juul Labs has insisted that it never marketed or knowingly sold its trendy e-cigarettes and flavored nicotine pods to teenagers.

headline.main: How Juul Hooked a Generation on Nicotine
headline.print_headline: How Juul Got a Generation Hooked

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention

byline.original: By Julie Creswell and Sheila Kaplan

docs.abstract: Altria is paying $12.8 billion to acquire a 35 percent stake of the popular vaping start-up. Public health advocates criticized the union.
docs.snippet: Altria is paying $12.8 billion to acquire a 35 percent stake of the popular vaping start-up. Public health advocates criticized the union.
docs.lead_paragraph: The tobacco giant Altria, maker of Marlboro and other top-selling brands of cigarettes, has agreed to pay nearly $13 billion for a 35 percent stake in Juul Labs, the wildly popular vaping company that burst on the scene in 2015 with a mission to render cigarettes obsolete.

headline.main: Juul Closes Deal with Tobacco Giant Altria
headline.print_headline: Juul’s Future Is Now Tied To Industry It Disrupted

byline.original: By Sheila Kaplan and Matt Richtel

docs.abstract: After making billions of dollars and joining forces with Big Tobacco, Juul is trying to reinvent itself as a public-health crusader.
docs.snippet: After making billions of dollars and joining forces with Big Tobacco, Juul is trying to reinvent itself as a public-health crusader.
docs.lead_paragraph: Juul Labs, the company behind the insanely popular vaping device, has a message for the nation’s estimated 37.8 million adult smokers:

docs.abstract: With Altria’s investment in Juul, a combination of the tobacco giants would dominate the international market for e-cigarettes.
docs.snippet: With Altria’s investment in Juul, a combination of the tobacco giants would dominate the international market for e-cigarettes.
docs.lead_paragraph: The tobacco giants Philip Morris International and the Altria Group are in talks to reunite, the companies said on Tuesday, in a deal that would combine the most popular brands of both traditional and electronic cigarettes.

headline.main: Philip Morris and Altria Are in Talks to Merge
headline.print_headline: Philip Morris and Altria in Talks to Form a Bigger Tobacco Giant

docs.abstract: Facing ire at home, the e-cigarette giant counted on international expansion to offset losses in the U.S., but the regulatory response abroad has been even stricter.
docs.snippet: Facing ire at home, the e-cigarette giant counted on international expansion to offset losses in the U.S., but the regulatory response abroad has been even stricter.
docs.lead_paragraph: In January 2019, the chairman of Altria, Howard A. Willard III, flew to Silicon Valley to speak to senior executives of Juul Labs, fresh off signing a deal for the tobacco giant to pay nearly $13 billion for a 35 percent stake in the popular e-cigarette company. With public fury growing over Juul’s contribution to the epidemic of teenage vaping, he laid out his vision for the company to continue to thrive.

headline.main: The World Pushes Back Against E-Cigarettes and Juul
headline.print_headline: The World Pushes Back Against E-Cigarettes

byline.original: By Sheila Kaplan, Andrew Jacobs and Choe Sang-Hun

docs.abstract: Commissioner Scott Gottlieb says the terms of the new partnership between the two companies appear to undermine pledges they made to keep flavored nicotine pods off store shelves.
docs.snippet: Commissioner Scott Gottlieb says the terms of the new partnership between the two companies appear to undermine pledges they made to keep flavored nicotine pods off store shelves.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — The Food and Drug Administration is accusing Juul and Altria of reneging on promises they made to the government to keep e-cigarettes away from minors.

headline.main: F.D.A. Accuses Juul and Altria of Backing Off Plan to Stop Youth Vaping
headline.print_headline: Juul’s Deal With Altria Vexes F.D.A.
